description: a(1)=2; if n = Product p_i^e_i, n>1, then a(n) = Product p_{i+1}^e_i.
references: From a puzzle proposed by _Marc LeBrun_.
maple: succfactorization := proc(n) local p,d; if(1 = n) then RETURN(2); fi; p := 1; for d in ifactors(n)[ 2 ] do p := p * (nextprime(d[ 1 ])^d[ 2 ]); od; RETURN(p); end;
mathematica: a[1] = 2; a[p_?PrimeQ] := a[p] = Prime[PrimePi[p] + 1]; a[n_] := a[n] = Times @@ (a[First[#]]^Last[#] &) /@ FactorInteger[n]; Table[ a[n], {n, 1, 65}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jul 18 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a045965 n = if n == 1 then 2 else a003961 n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 12 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A048673. Essentially identical to A003961.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
